gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕੀਯੋ ਚਿਤ ਮੈ ਭਜਹੌ ੲਿਹ ਤੋ ੲਿਹ ਪਾਛੇ ਪਰੈ ਹੌ || ਜੈਹੋ ਹੳੁ ਥੋਰੇੲੀ ਬੀਚ ਚਲਯੋ ਤਨ ਭੇਟਨ ਯਾਹ ਮਲੇਛ ਨ ਦੈ ਹੌ ||
transliteration: Ek Bichaar Keeyo Chit Mai Bhajhau Eh To Eh Paachhe Darai Hau|| Jaiho Hau Thore-ibeech Chadyo Tan Bhetan Yaah Malechh Na Dai Hau||
translation: Krishna thought in his mind that if he would run, then the malechha would run after him; he would enter some cave, but he would not like that malechha to touch his body;

gurmukhi: ਸੋਵਤ ਹੈ ਮੁਚਕੰਦ ਜਹਾਂ ਧਸਿ ਵਾਹੀ ਗੁਫਾ ਮਹਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਜਗੈ ਹੌ || ਜੈਹੋ ਬਚਾੲਿ ਮੈ ਅਾਪਨ ਕੈ ਤਿਹ ਡੀਠਹ ਸੋ ੲਿਹ ਕੋ ਜਰਵੈਹੌ ||੧੯੨੧||
transliteration: Sovat Hai Mouchkand Jahaan Dhas(i) Vaahigouphaa Maih Jaae Jagad Hau|| Jaiho Bachaae Mai Aapan Kai Tih Deethah So Eh Ko Jarvai Hau||1921||
translation: He woule awaken the sleeping Muchukund (the son of Mandhata, who had been given the boon that anyone who awakens him from sleep, will be reduced to ashes); he would conceal himself, but get the malechha killed with the fire of the sight of Muchukund.1921.

gurmukhi: ਤੳੁ ੲਿਹ ਸ੍ਵਰਗਹਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਜੳੁ ੲਿਹ ਰਨ ਭੀਤਰ ਹਨੳੁ || ਅਗਨ ਭੲੇ ਜਰਵਾੲਿ ਖ੍ਵੈ ਹੋ ਧਰਮ ਮਲੇਛ ਕੋ ||੧੯੨੨||
transliteration: Tau Eh Svargad(i) Jaae Eh Ran Bheetar Hanau|| Agad Bhae Jarvaae Khvai Ho Dharam Malechh Ko||1922||
translation: If he kills him (Kalyavana) while fighting, he would go to heaven, therefore he would get him to be reduced to ashes by fire, so that his dharma (characteristic) as malechha remains intact.1922.

gurmukhi: ਛੋਰ ਕੈ ਸਯੰਦਨ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰਨ ਤਯਾਗ ਕੈ ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਭਗਯੋ ਜਨੁ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ਬਢਾਯੋ || ਵਾਹਿ ਲਖਯੋ ਕਿ ਭਜਯੋ ਮੁਹਿ ਤੇ ਮਥੁਰਾ ਹੂ ਕੇ ਨਾੲਿਕ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਕਹਿ ਧਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Chhodh Kai Syandan Shastran Tyaag Kai Kaahn Bhagyo Jan(u) Traas Badhaayo|| Vaah(i) Lakhyo Ki Bhaayo Muh(i) Te Mathuraa Hoo Ke Naai Hvai Kah(i) Dhaayo||
translation: Leaving his chariot and forsaking his weapons, Krishna fled, frightening everyone; Kalyavana had thought that he had run away, being fearful of him, therefore he pursued Krishna, calling him;

gurmukhi: ਸੋਵਤ ਥੋ ਮੁਚਕੰਦ ਜਹਾਂ ਸੁ ਤਹਾਂ ਹੀ ਗਯੋ ਤਿਹ ਜਾੲਿ ਜਗਾਯੋ || ਅਾਪ ਬਚਾੲਿ ਗਯੋ ਤਨ ਕੋ ੲਿਹ ਅਾਵਤ ਥੇ ੲਿਹ ਕੋ ਜਰਵਾਯੋ ||੧੯੨੩||
transliteration: Sovat Tho Mouchkand Jahaan Su Tahaan Higado Tih Jaae Jagadyo|| Oop Bachaae Gado Tan Ko Eh Aavat The Eh Ko Jarvaayo||1923||
translation: Krishna reached there where Muchukund was sleeping and he awakened by him by kicking him and then concealed himself; in this way, Krishna saved himself, but got Kalyavana reduced to ashes.1923.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਨ ਕੋ ਬਚਵਾੲਿ ਗਯੋ ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਮੁਚਕੰਦ ਤੇ || ਤਜੀ ਨੀਦ ਤਿਹ ਰਾੲਿ ਹੇਰਤ ਭਸਮ ਮਲੇਛ ਭਯੋ ||੧੯੨੪||
transliteration: Oopan Ko Bachvaae Gado Kaahn Mouchkand Te|| Tajineed Tih Raae Heart Bhasam Malechh Bhyo||1924||
translation: Krishna saved himself from Muchukund, but when Muchukund awoke from sleep and saw towards Kalyavana, he was reduced to ashes.1924.

gurmukhi: ਜਰ ਛਾਰ ਮਲੇਛ ਭਯੋ ਜਬ ਹੀ ਮੁਚਕੰਦ ਪੈ ਤੳੁ ਬ੍ਰਿਜ ਭੂਖਨ ਅਾਯੋ || ਅਾਵਤ ਹੀ ਤਿਹ ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਕੋ ਹੇਰ ਕੈ ਪਾੲਿਨ ੳੂਪਰਿ ਸੀਸ ਝੁਕਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Jar Chhaad Malechh Bhayo Jab Himouchkand Pai Tau Brij Bhookhan Aayo|| Oovat Hitih Kaahn Ko Her Kai Paain Oopar(i) Sees Jhoukaayo||
translation: When Kalyavana was burnt and reduced to ashes, then Krishna came to Muchukund; on seeing Krishna, Muchukund bowed his head at his feet;

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਰ ਜਿਤੋ ਦੁਖੁ ਥੋ ਤਿਹ ਕੋ ਹਰਿ ਬਾਤਨ ਸੋ ਤਿਹ ਤਾਪ ਬੁਝਾਯੋ || ਅੈਸ ਸਮੋਧ ਕੈ ਤਾ ਤਿਹ ਜਾਰ ਕੈ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬ੍ਰਿਜਨਾੲਿਕ ਡੇਰਨ ਅਾਯੋ ||੧੯੨੫||
transliteration: Aur Jito Doukh(u) Tho Tih Ko Har(i) Baatan So Tih Taap Bujhaayo|| Ais Samodh Kai Taa Tih Jaar Kai Sribrijnaaik Deran Aayo||1925||
translation: The Lord Krishna consoled him with his words and instructing Muchukund and getting Kalyavana reduced to ashes, he went to his home.1925.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਨਾਵਤਾਰੇ ਕਾਲਜਮਨ ਬਧਹਿ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤ ||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Kaaljamanndbadhah(i) Dhiaae Samaapat||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Kalyavana” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
